adjective.description: (especially of liquor, computer software, or recordings) made, distributed, or sold illegally.

verb.description: Make, distribute, or sell (illicit goods, especially liquor, computer software, or recordings) illegally.
examples: he amassed a fortune bootlegging whiskey

noun.description: An illegal musical recording, especially one made at a concert.
A play in which the quarterback fakes a handoff and runs with the ball hidden next to his hip.
examples: he scored on a 29-yard bootleg on fourth down

origin: Late 19th century: from the smugglers' practice of concealing bottles in their boots.
